thread.title: Transgender boy moves within one win of girls wrestling title
thread.title_full: Transgender boy moves within one win of girls wrestling title

author: Adam Coleman
title: Transgender boy moves within one win of girls wrestling title
text:
Photo: Jason Fochtman/Houston Chronicle Image 6 of 22 Mack Beggs, right, a transgender wrestler from Euless Trinity High School, waits along with his grandmother, Nancy Beggs, left, for his quarterfinals match during the State Wrestling Tournament at the Berry Center, 8877 Barker Cypress Road, Friday, Feb. 24, 2017, in Cypress. Beggs was born a girl and is transitioning to male but wrestles in the girls division. less Mack Beggs, right, a transgender wrestler from Euless Trinity High School, waits along with his grandmother, Nancy Beggs, left, for his quarterfinals match during the State Wrestling Tournament at the Berry ... more Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 7 of 22 Mack Beggs, top, a transgender wrestler from Euless Trinity High School, is shown with his coach Travis Clark during a quarterfinals match against Mya Engert of Amarillo Tascosa during the State Wrestling Tournament at the Berry Center, 8877 Barker Cypress Road, Friday, Feb. 24, 2017, in Cypress. Beggs was born a girl and is transitioning to male but wrestles in the girls division. less Mack Beggs, top, a transgender wrestler from Euless Trinity High School, is shown with his coach Travis Clark during a quarterfinals match against Mya Engert of Amarillo Tascosa during the State Wrestling ... more Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 8 of 22 In this Feb. 18, 2017 photo, Euless Trinity's Mack Beggs is consoled by coach Travis Clark after Beggs' opponent forfeited during the finals of the UIL Region 2-6A wrestling tournament at Allen High School in Allen, Texas. Beggs, who is transgender, is transitioning from female to male, won the girls regional championship. (Nathan Hunsinger/The Dallas Morning News via AP) less In this Feb. 18, 2017 photo, Euless Trinity's Mack Beggs is consoled by coach Travis Clark after Beggs' opponent forfeited during the finals of the UIL Region 2-6A wrestling tournament at Allen High School in ... more Photo: Nathan Hunsinger, MBR Image 9 of 22 In this Feb. 18, 2017 photo, Euless Trinity's Mack Beggs is announced as the winner of a semifinal match after Beggs pinned Grand Prairie's Kailyn Clay during the finals of the UIL Region 2-6A wrestling tournament at Allen High School in Allen, Texas. Beggs, who is transgender, is transitioning from female to male, won the girls regional championship after a female opponent forfeited the match. (Nathan Hunsinger/The Dallas Morning News via AP) less In this Feb. 18, 2017 photo, Euless Trinity's Mack Beggs is announced as the winner of a semifinal match after Beggs pinned Grand Prairie's Kailyn Clay during the finals of the UIL Region 2-6A wrestling ... more Photo: Nathan Hunsinger, MBR Image 10 of 22 
Euless Trinity's Mack Beggs motions during a Class 6A girls 110-pound bout against Clear Spring's Taylor Latham at the UIL Wrestling State Championships at the Berry Center Friday, Feb. 24, 2017, in Cypress. The 17-year-old Beggs began taking testosterone in 2015 to transition from female to male. University Interscholastic League rules, however, dictate that he must compete in the girls division, corresponding to the gender identity inscribed on his birth certificate.
